Uses of Interface
org.itsnat.core.domutil.ElementTreeNode

Packages that use ElementTreeNode
org.itsnat.core.domutil Contains utilities to manipulate DOM elements using the pattern approach (lists, tables and trees) and other utility classes and interfaces. 
 

Uses of ElementTreeNode in org.itsnat.core.domutil
 

Methods in org.itsnat.core.domutil that return ElementTreeNode
 ElementTreeNode ElementTree.addRootNode()
          Adds a root tree node.
 ElementTreeNode ElementTree.addRootNode(java.lang.Object value)
          Adds a root tree node and renders the value using the current structure and renderer.
 ElementTreeNode ElementTreeNodeList.addTreeNode()
          Adds a new child tree node at the end of the list using the pattern (the new tree node markup is a clone).
 ElementTreeNode ElementTreeNodeList.addTreeNode(java.lang.Object value)
          Adds a new child tree node at the end of the list and renders the specified value using the current structure and renderer.

          Creates a pattern based DOM element tree node.

          Creates a pattern based DOM element tree node.
 ElementTreeNode ElementTreeNodeList.getElementTreeNodeFromNode(org.w3c.dom.Node node)
          Returns the tree node containing the specified node.
 ElementTreeNode ElementTreeNode.getElementTreeNodeFromNode(org.w3c.dom.Node node)
          Returns this tree node or the tree node containing the specified node.
 ElementTreeNode ElementTree.getElementTreeNodeFromNode(org.w3c.dom.Node node)
          Returns the tree node containing the specified node.
 ElementTreeNode ElementTree.getElementTreeNodeFromRow(int row)
          Returns the tree node at the specified row position seeing the tree as a list (root node is 0).
 ElementTreeNode ElementTreeNode.getElementTreeNodeParent()
          Returns the parent tree node if exists.
 ElementTreeNode ElementTreeNodeList.getFirstTreeNode()
          Returns the first child tree node (position 0).
 ElementTreeNode ElementTreeNodeList.getLastTreeNode()
          Returns the last child tree node (position getLength() - 1).
 ElementTreeNode ElementTreeNode.getNextSiblingTreeNode()
          Returns the tree node immediately following this tree node (same level).
 ElementTreeNode ElementTreeNode.getNextTreeNode()
          Returns the next tree node in the logical order of the tree (seen as a list).
 ElementTreeNode ElementTreeNode.getPreviousSiblingTreeNode()
          Returns the tree node immediately preceding this tree node (same level).
 ElementTreeNode ElementTreeNode.getPreviousTreeNode()
          Returns the previous tree node in the logical order of the tree (seen as a list).
 ElementTreeNode ElementTree.getRootNode()
          Returns the root tree node.
 ElementTreeNode ElementTreeNodeList.getTreeNodeAt(int index)
          Returns the tree node at the specified index.
 ElementTreeNode[] ElementTreeNodeList.getTreeNodes()
          Returns the tree node list as an array.
 ElementTreeNode ElementTreeNodeList.insertTreeNodeAt(int index)
          Inserts a new child tree node at the specified position using the pattern (the new tree node markup is a clone).
 ElementTreeNode ElementTreeNodeList.insertTreeNodeAt(int index, java.lang.Object value)
          Inserts a new child tree node at the specified position and renders the specified value using the current structure and renderer.
 ElementTreeNode ElementTreeNodeList.removeTreeNodeAt(int index)
          Removes the specified tree node.
